Class SynthListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • SynthListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ActionListener, EventListener, SynthConstants

    public class SynthListener
extends Object
implements ActionListener, SynthConstants

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected class  SynthListener.SeqThread
      Extended Thread that activates Nodes of a Sequence
      protected class  SynthListener.SequenceTimer
      Extended Timer that stores an associated Sequence for activation
      protected class  SynthListener.SynthAction
      Creates an abstract action that is associated to one of three SynthTypes in order to interface with the HashMaps

        private volatile boolean slSafeMode
        Holds the information regarding whether safe mode is active. Safe mode will disable all notes above MIDI integer #96 from sounding unless this value is set to false

    • Constructor Detail

      • SynthListener

        public SynthListener(JComponent c,
                     int delay)
        Initialize the SynthListener onto the component with the minimum delay the current system can handle
        Parameters:
        c - JComponent that is read for inputs
        delay - Integer representing the safe value of milliseconds the system can sleep for as well as the values for most timers being fired. If this value is improperly set, there is a strong likelihood that ThreadInterruptedExceptions will be encountered when running actions set on looping timers using the doSleep(int) method

        public boolean setSoundbank(File file)
        Unloads the synthesizer and sets the instruments contained within the file to the synthesizer
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        True if the synthesizer was capable of loading all instruments.

                        int actID,
                        int actVal,
                        int[] channels)
        Creates an action that listens for KeyEvents to activate system functions
        Parameters:
        keyCode - Integer representing the KeyEvent associated to the action
        actID - Integer representing the type of action to be performed
        actVal - Integer representing the value to be activated by a given ID
        channels - Integer array representing the channels to be affected

      • addSeqAction

        public void addSeqAction(int keyCode,
                         File stream,
                         int chanVal)
                  throws BadMIDISequenceException
        Creates an action that listens for KeyEvents to activate sequence playback
        Parameters:
        keyCode - Integer representing the KeyEvent associated to the action
        stream - File holding the MIDI data for playback
        chanVal - Integer storing the sequence playback channel (MIDI 1.0)
        Throws:
        BadMIDISequenceException - when the stream cannot be converted

      • addNoteAction

        public void addNoteAction(int keyCode,
                          int noteValue,
                          int velValue,
                          int durValue,
                          int chanValue,
                          int octValue)
        Creates an action that listens for KeyEvents in order to play notes
        Parameters:
        keyCode - Integer representing the KeyEvent associated to the action
        noteValue - Integer holding the pitch of the note (MIDI 1.0)
        velValue - Integer holding the velocity of the note (MIDI 1.0)
        durValue - Integer holding the duration of the note (MIDI 1.0)
        chanValue - Integer storing the note's performance channel (MIDI 1.0)
        octValue - Interger representing the octave side for displacements

      • doUpdatePanels

        private void doUpdatePanels(boolean reset)
        Handles all updating of panels after an action has been performed
        Parameters:
        reset - Used to determine whether the Synth has experienced a "reset". If it is true, it resets the front panel in addition to everything else. Otherwise, it will only update the side panels as other things aren't being reset.

        private SynthSys getSynthSys(SynthButton sb)

        Parameters:
        sb - SynthButton being parsed for values
        Returns:
        The created SynthSys object

      • toggleReading

        public void toggleReading()
        Method intended to be used by the class using SynthListener, toggles whether new notes are being read as inputs or not. If "reading" is off, no notes or sequences will sound until reading is back on again

      • setReading

        Parameters:

        Parameters:
        b - Boolean to be set to the safemode value

      • changeOverride

        public void changeOverride(int seqNumber,
                           boolean b)
        Changes the specified sequence's state to the value of the parameter. A value of true will prevent the instrument stored within the sequence from being activated, allowing it to be set to a value specified elsewhere.
        Parameters:
        seqNumber - Sequence being overridden
        b - State to set the override to

      • checkOverride

        public boolean checkOverride(int seqNumber)
        Checks if a given sequence's instrument is currently being overridden
        Parameters:
        seqNumber - Sequence being checked
        Returns:
        True is being overridden

        eID - ID of the event to set the value to
        eVal - Value to set

      • ctrlSet

                     int eID,
                     int eVal)

      • ctrlValue

        private void ctrlValue(int channel,
                       int id,
                       int value)
        Helper method to control specific instances of System actions on a given channel that directly interface with variable values and not states
        Parameters:
        channel - Integer representing the channel affected.
        id - Identifier of the type of action taking place
        value - Value being adjusted, used by setting values

      • ctrlValue

        private void ctrlValue(int[] chArray,
                       int id,
                       int value)
        Helper method to control specific instances of System actions on multiple channels that directly interface with variable values and not states
        Parameters:
        chArray - Integer array representing the channels affected. If only one channel is affected, the array will be of size 1
        id - Identifier of the type of action taking place
        value - Value being adjusted, used by setting values

      • incrementBoundedValue

        public static int incrementBoundedValue(int origin,
                                        int delta,
                                        int max)
        Helper method designed to return an integer modified by a delta within the bounds of zero and a maximized value
        Parameters:
        origin - Integer representing the original value being modified
        delta - Integer representing the delta to be applied to the original
        max - Integer representing the max value binding the original
        Returns:
        The properly modified bounded value

      • checkIfIntIsSafe

        private boolean checkIfIntIsSafe(int value,
                                 Note note)
        Checks if a value of a note is safe, and if it is not it will disable the note from being played
        Parameters:
        value - Value being checked
        note - Note being disabled from playing
        Returns:
        True if the note was safe, otherwise it will return false and handle actions accordingly

      • activateSynthSys

        private void activateSynthSys(SynthSys ss,
                              boolean fromKeyboard)
        Activates a SynthSys action with all the properties of the given SynthSys.
        Parameters:
        ss - SynthSys being activated
        fromKeyboard - Boolean representing the origin of the SynthSys action. If the action was from something other than the keyboard, it will be false.
